summary: An email from attorney Robert Y. Lewis to prosecutors regarding a victim client who wishes to attend the upcoming Ghislaine Maxwell trial. The victim had previously delivered an impact statement at Jeffrey Epstein's case dismissal hearing in August 2019. The email requests information about trial admission protocols.

events.title: Epstein Indictment Dismissal Hearing
events.description: Judge Berman dismissed the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein due to his apparent suicide. Victim impact statements were delivered, including by the attorney's client.

events.title: Scheduled Start of Maxwell Trial
events.description: The criminal trial of Ghislaine Maxwell is scheduled to commence before Judge Nathan.

keyFacts: A victim of Epstein and Maxwell, represented by attorney Robert Lewis, wishes to attend the Maxwell trial set for November 29, 2021.
The same victim had previously delivered a victim impact statement at the August 29, 2019 hearing where Judge Berman dismissed the Epstein indictment following Epstein's death.
The email is a formal request from victim's counsel to prosecutors (Marsh, Pecorino) for information on trial admission protocols, indicating logistical planning for victim attendance.
The document confirms the ongoing legal proceedings against Ghislaine Maxwell and the involvement of victims in those proceedings.
